Our Menu - Jerusalem Garden

jerusalemgarden

ann arbor’s freshest middle eastern eatery est. JOST

WELCOME! We are a focal, independent eatery proudly offering
fresh, delicious Middle Eastern fare. Palestinian immigrant Mr. R. opened
JG in summer 1987 in a tiny shop on Fifth Ave. in 2015, we moved
around the corner to Liberty St., offering the same delicious food ina
bright, more spacious dining room. We love calling Ann Arbor home—
we hope you enjoy your culinary experience!

Please visit JERUSALEMGARDEN.NET
or email us: catering@jerusalemgarden.net

https://jerusalemgarden.net/menu/

Address: 314 E Liberty St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Snug, quick-serve option with a patio offers hefty portions of Lebanese fare plus Turkish coffees.

summary.snippet: "Great service and tasty food, friendly atmosphere and staff 👍"
"I ordered the chicken shawarma meal with hummus and a Turkish coffee."
"Food portions were small for the price and rice was overly oily."

most_relevant.description: If you want to enjoy some amazing Mediterranean, Jerusalem Garden is a great option in Ann Arbor! The Beef  Shawarma is so tasty. Also loved the fries! Super crisp and buttery. My wife got the falafel which she said was great as well!

My first time at this authentic Palestinian restaurant that serves a variety of Middle Eastern food. I had the kafta and chicken platter with hummus. Both delicious and reasonably priced. Will definitely be back on my next visit to Ann Arbor. Ignore the ketchup on my plate. I did that 😋

Bright lively atmosphere, open kitchen, good staff. Ordered the chicken shawarma. Wrapped in delicate pita, grilled chicken, delightful garlicky sauce, crispy romaine and plump tomatoes. Mmmmm! There is a reason this place is a must-see in Ann Arbor! It does not disappoint.

Our experience was very average across the board.  Food portions were small for the price and rice was overly oily. The server would just leave items at the end of the table to be passed instead of delivering them to each person.  They forgot one party members side of falafel.  The baba ganoush was really bitter.  The old building had more charm than the new digs.

First time here.
The food was ok, I ordered chicken and hummus. In my opinion, there wasn’t enough hummus. The chicken was ok but a bit dry. I liked the rice however it was oily and I ended up not eating much of it. I got a side of fattoush, it was a good size but it wasn’t a real fattoush. It had lots of other veggies in it.

Food was yummy, the con is the portions are a little small for the price. The fattoush salad was decent, hummus is yummy! I wish the hummus came with more bread, it came with maybe 2 pieces of bread. Staff very kind. Vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options. Love that it is Palestinian owned!

Being right next to the U of M, its a nice location to be. Parking is on the street so can be hard to find if it is a busy time. Went at 12 on a Wednesday and there was enough space for us. We dined in and got seated right away with our food being delivered very quickly after placing orders. I got the chicken shawarma with 2 sides, the salad and hummus and 2 falafel patties. The chicken shawarma was soooo good. It came with a yogurt almost tzatziki like sauce and was cool and refreshing to match the amazing seasoned chicken. It was served with some brown rice that was amazingly done (4/5). The salad was refreshing and had some toasted pita bread on it for a crunch and was perfect for the summer heat (4/5). The hummus was one of the best hummus I've ever had, perfect in its taste (5/5). Lastly, the falafel patties, they were a bit crunchy and done on the outside but it was still so good when you get to he flavor in the middle (3.5/5). Lastly, couldn't leave without the dessert, pistachio baklava. This was so delicious and flaky. The amount of sweetness matched with the pistachio saltyness, one if the best baklava I've had (4.5/5). The atmosphere matches the food perfectly and service was friendly, would def visit again!

I loved this experience. The story of the founding family is genuinely heartwarming. This is a family who knows what it means to be in hospitality. The menu is just the right size and the value is outstanding. Our server provided the right balance of support and distance. Can’t wait to return!
